intro: Ipomoea polymorpha subf. sericea, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-tomentose leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is a herbaceous vine that typically grows along the ground or climbing supports. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native habitats.
